data.name: AbilitiesList_Help
data.value: Swipe right to edit and swipe left to delete.

data.name: AbilityEXPOverflowMessage
data.value: You cannot save such parameters to the ability, as you do not have enough experience points for this. Weaken the ability or exit editing without saving using the back button in the top left corner.

data.name: AbilityNeedToRecharge
data.value: The number of uses per day is limited.

data.name: ActionPointAspectHint
data.value: Almost any ability is used by spending action points. The more action points an ability spends, the cheaper it will be in experience points.

data.name: ActionPointsMustBeThreeIfTriggersExists
data.value: Action points should be equal to three if the ability has activation triggers.

data.name: ActivationConditionsHint
data.value: The effect will be applied only if all the specified conditions are met by the time the ability is activated.

data.name: ActivationTriggersHint
data.value: An ability can be activated automatically if you add activation triggers to it. A trigger is an event that must occur for an ability to activate without spending action points. With each added trigger the ability will become more expensive.

data.name: AddHealthHint
data.value: You can increase the amount of health points your character has by pouring experience points into it. Be careful, the cost scale is progressive and the more experience you pour into health, the more expensive each health point will be.

data.name: AddHealthNotEnoughExpAlert
data.value: You have no enough experience points to add that health points count to your character.

data.name: AlertNPCCannotHaveRecharge
data.value: NPC cannot have an ability with recharge option.

data.name: AlertSameEffectExists
data.value: Effect with same type already exists in ability. Choose other effect or edit existing effect, please.

data.name: AreaBindingHint
data.value: An area that exists for some time remains in place and is tied to a certain point in space. But it can also be attached to a character or object and move along with the object of attachment.

data.name: AskDeleteMaterialSupport
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete «{0}» ability material support?

data.name: AskDeleteProject
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete project «{0}»?

data.name: AskDeleteStatus
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete status «{0}»?

data.name: AskIfYouWantToConcord
data.value: Are you sure you want to concord the aspect? This aspect will be synchronized with other effects and the old settings will be lost.

data.name: AskToDeleteInventoryItem
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete «{0}»?

data.name: AskWantToResetAllCharactersData
data.value: Are you sure you want to reset all characters data?

data.name: AspectAOEHint
data.value: Effect area. For example, the shape of an area with difficult terrain, the shape of a shield, or an area where creatures can be summoned.

data.name: AspectVampirismHint
data.value: Heals a character by percent of the damage he inflicted.

data.name: CharacterCanDisableEffect
data.value: Can the character cancel the effect?

data.name: CharacterCanDisableEffectHint
data.value: There is an option when a character can cancel a long-term effect that he himself created without spending resources, but this option increases the cost of the ability.

data.name: CharacterList_Help
data.value: Tap to select, swipe right to edit and swipe left to delete.

data.name: CharacterSpeed_Help
data.value: A character's speed is the distance in meters that he can walk in one round without spending action points. Also, the character can additionally spend action points and move a distance equal to one fifth of the speed for each action point, this distance is measured in m/AP or in «MAPs». When moving using grid, the MAP or the sum of the MAPs is rounded to an integer.

data.name: CharacterStatusesPageHelp
data.value: To edit a status, slide the status card to the right; to delete, slide it to the left.

data.name: CooldownAspectHint
data.value: Specify whether the number of uses of the ability per day is limited and how many uses per day are available.

data.name: DamageEffectPageHint
data.value: Here is the set of dice or value you should use to decide how much damage your ability dealt.

data.name: DeleteAbilityQuestion
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the ability?

data.name: DeleteCharacterQuestion
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the character?

data.name: DeleteEffectQuestion
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the effect?

data.name: DicePoolEditorNoDices
data.value: The formula is empty, to add elements to the formula, click the «Edit» button.

data.name: DiceValuePopupHint
data.value: Enter the value in the format commonly used for dice formulas. For example, 3d6 + 2d4 + 5. In such formulas, the number before «d» means the number of dice, the number after «d» - the number of faces on the dice of this type. You can use custom dice like d11 or d19 if you like.

data.name: DurationHint
data.value: You can specify the time for which the effect will last.

data.name: EditAbility_Help
data.value: To add an effect, click the big plus button in the effects list. To remove an effect, slide its card to the left, to edit it, move it to the right. If the ability has material support, you can remove its element with a double tap.

data.name: EffectAccelerationHint
data.value: Increases the target's maximum action points.

data.name: EffectAmplificationHint
data.value: Increases the damage the target deals.

data.name: EffectCancelationHint
data.value: Prevents the target from activating an ability. The effect only triggers if an ability with that effect was activated by a reaction or trigger. The power ability being canceled must not exceed the specified experience point limit.

data.name: EffectCleanseHint
data.value: Removing statuses from a target. Several statuses can be removed. The character decides which statuses will be removed, but each status must not exceed the status power limit.

data.name: EffectDangerousTerrainHint
data.value: Creates an area that deals damage to a character who has started a move in it or moved 1 meter within it.

data.name: EffectDecelerationHint
data.value: Decreases the target's maximum action points.

data.name: EffectDefenseHint
data.value: Any damage to the target is decreased by the specified amount.

data.name: EffectDifficultTerrainHint
data.value: Creates a difficult terrain with specified difficulty class.

data.name: EffectMoveAreaHint
data.value: Moves the area of ​​effect of an ability a specified distance in any direction.

data.name: EffectMoveCharacterHint
data.value: The effect allows the character to change his position in space according to the rules of movement. Movement speed refers to the distance a character can move by spending one action point.

data.name: EffectMoveTargetHint
data.value: Moves the target along a specified path for a specified distance.

data.name: EffectMutenessHint
data.value: Prevent targets to use abilities with «Need able to talk» activation condition. Effect can be aplied on target only if target have specified amount of health or less.

data.name: EffectParalysisHint
data.value: Prevent targets to use abilities with «Need able to move» activation condition. Also, a target with paralysis cannot move in any way except using abilities that do not have such an activation condition. Effect can be aplied on target only if target have specified amount of health or less.

data.name: EffectPeriodicDamageHint
data.value: Deals damage to the target once per round for a certain number of rounds.

data.name: EffectPeriodicHealHint
data.value: Heals target at the end of targets turn for the specified duration.

data.name: EffectProvokeHint
data.value: The target on which the effect is applied, during the duration of the effect, can attack and impose negative effects only on the provocateur and cannot harm other targets

data.name: EffectProvokeHint2
data.value: A provoked target can still harm its other opponents if at the same time it harms the provocateur. For example, using area abilities or abilities that apply to targets along the chain.

data.name: EffectProvokeHint3
data.value: If the target is provoked by several provocateurs, then it can harm any of them at its discretion.

data.name: EffectReductionHint
data.value: Decreases the damage the target deals.

data.name: EffectRevengeHint
data.value: The character declares activation and starts accumulating incoming damage for a set number of rounds. Before this time expires, the character can use the reaction and deal all the accumulated damage to the opponents.

data.name: EffectSelfDamageHint
data.value: Deals damage to the character himself and makes the ability cheaper. The maximum damage that a character's ability deals must not exceed the maximum value of character health. According to the list of effects, the "Self-destruction" is applied last. The amplification does not affect the damage that is dealt to the character in this way.

data.name: EffectShieldHint
data.value: The effect creates a shield that protects the targets behind it from damage. It has strength expressed in health points.

data.name: EffectVulnerabilityHint
data.value: Any damage to the target is increased by the specified amount.

data.name: EnterHardActivationCondition
data.value: Specify a condition that is difficult to reproduce or a condition of high rarity.

data.name: EnterHighProbabilityTrigger
data.value: Enter a high probability trigger, for example: "Character has taken damage."

data.name: EnterHighRarityRestriction
data.value: Enter a sign of high rarity, continuing the sentence: "Target...". For example: "Must have a tattoo", "Must be a dragon", "Must be born in June".

data.name: EnterLowActivationCondition
data.value: Specify an easily reproducible condition or a condition of low rarity.

data.name: EnterLowProbabilityTrigger
data.value: Enter a low probability trigger, for example: "The character is being attacked by an undead."

data.name: EnterLowRarityRestriction
data.value: Enter a low rarity property, continuing the sentence: "Target...". For example: "Must be female", "Must be an elf", "Must have a soul", "Must be made of wood".

data.name: EnterMediumActivationCondition
data.value: Indicate a condition that is difficult to reproduce or a condition of medium rarity.

data.name: EnterMediumRarityRestriction
data.value: Enter a sign of medium rarity, continuing the sentence: Target...". For example: “Must be in armor”, “Must be in water”, “Must breathe”.

data.name: EnterStandartProbabilityTrigger
data.value: Enter a trigger with a standard probability, for example: “An ally was attacked from afar.”

data.name: ExhaustionEffectPageHint
data.value: Temporarily decreases the target's maximum health. The cost scale is progressive and depends on the amount by which health is increased. The amount by which health is reduced can be determined by rolling the dice.

data.name: FortifyEffectPageHint
data.value: Temporarily increases the target's maximum health. The cost scale is progressive and depends on the amount by which health is increased. The number of bonus health points can be determined by rolling the dice.

data.name: HealDiceImpactHint
data.value: Each time you use the ability, roll the set of dice listed below to determine how many health points the ability restored.

data.name: HighRarityProperty
data.value: Must have an high rarity property

data.name: InventoryAbilitiesWillRisePrice
data.value: Some abilities depend on this supply, if you remove it, they will take more experience points. Delete?

data.name: InventoryAdjustCoinsHint
data.value: You have changed the cost of the item and can adjust the amount of coins available to the character according to the new value.

data.name: InventoryAskAdjustCoinsAlert
data.value: You have changed the number of consumables and can automatically adjust the number of coins available to the character according to the new value. Adjust?

data.name: InventoryItemIsAvailiable
data.value: Is the equipment available to the character?

data.name: InventoryItemWasConatinerAlert
data.value: The editing item was a container and contained other items. Its type has changed and now it cannot store its content, delete this content?

data.name: InventoryNotEnoughCoinsAlert
data.value: You don't have enough coins in your inventory to store this item. Change the cost of the item or turn off the «Adjust» flag so that the cost of the item does not affect the number of coins in the inventory.

data.name: InventoryNotEnoughEXPForChanges
data.value: Some abilities depend on this material support and the character does not have enough experience points to apply such changes.

data.name: InventoryNotEnoughEXPForDelete
data.value: You will run out of experience points for your current abilities if you remove this item. First, edit the abilities dependent on this item or remove them.

data.name: InventorySameNameAlert
data.value: Name is empty or there are already an item with the same name in the inventory.

data.name: Inventory_Help
data.value: Tap an item in your inventory to edit it, double tap to delete it, or swipe on the item name from left to right to open the description. By swiping an element from right to left, you can change its quantity.

data.name: IsAreaDisposable
data.value: Does the area trigger once and disappear?

data.name: LowRarityProperty
data.value: Must have an low rarity property

data.name: MarkOfFateHint
data.value: Enter the mark of fate assigned to you by the game master.

data.name: MediumRarityProperty
data.value: Must have an medium rarity property

data.name: NoMoreThanOneSelfDamageEffectMessage
data.value: An ability can have only one effect, causing damage to the character itself.

data.name: NoSpecialActivationConditions
data.value: There is no special activation conditions.

data.name: NotEnoughEXPForSpeed
data.value: Not enough EXP for such speed adjustments.

data.name: PlayerHaveNoCharacter
data.value: Looks like you haven't created any character yet. It is a good reason to create one. Fortunately, there is a button at the bottom of this page specifically for such cases.

data.name: PortraitHint
data.value: Click the «Browse» button and select a character image. You can customize the portrait by zooming in, zooming out and moving the image in the window below.

data.name: ProjectsHelp
data.value: Character projects are affairs for which progress needs to be tracked. To add a project, tap the plus sign button below. To edit a project, swipe the project card to the right; to delete it, swipe it to the left. To open the project description tap on its name. To increase the progress by one step tap the round progress bar or double tap to decrease it.

data.name: RemoveNPCQuestion
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this NPC?

data.name: SameProjectExistsWarning
data.value: A project with the same name already exists.

data.name: TargetChainHint
data.value: Targets can form chains. This means that once an effect is applied to a target, it can also be applied to the next target at a given distance from the previous one, and so on. The effect can only be applied once to each target within the chain. The distance is indicated in meters. The maximum number of targets in a chain and the distance between targets is limited. The character himself chooses the order of the targets in the chain.

data.name: TargetChainObstacleHint
data.value: The effect cannot be applied to the next target in the chain if there is an obstacle with the indicated durability equivalent or stronger between it and the previous target.

data.name: TargetSelectionAreaObstacleHint
data.value: The effect cannot be applied if there is an obstacle equal to or stronger than the selected equivalent in strength between the character and the nearest point of the area of ​​effect. Also, the effect cannot be applied to the target if there is an obstacle between it and the epicenter of the area of ​​effect that is equal in strength to the equivalent or stronger than it. The strength for these two types of obstacles is configured separately.

data.name: TargetSelectionEcludeTargetsHint
data.value: It is possible to fine-tune the area so that certain targets in the area selected by the character will not be affected. The more such targets a character can exclude, the more expensive the ability.

data.name: TargetSelectionIsRandomHint
data.value: If the random target selection mode is selected, then the player, when using the ability, will have to select a random target from those that satisfy the other conditions. This will complicate the planning of actions, but it will make the ability cheaper.

data.name: TargetSelectionNTADObstacleHint
data.value: The effect cannot be applied to the target if there is an obstacle equal to or stronger than the equivalent durability between it and the character.

data.name: TargetSelectionStratedyAreaHint
data.value: With this strategy, the effect is applied to targets located in the specified area. All area parameters are specified in meters. An area can be placed at any angle relative to the character, and the area distance is the distance from the character to the nearest point in that area.

data.name: TargetSelectionStratedyCharacterHint
data.value: The target is the character himself.

data.name: TargetSelectionStratedyNTADHint
data.value: With this strategy, the effect is applied to a limited number of targets that are no further than the set range. You can not choose same target multiple times.

data.name: TargetSelectionStrategyHint
data.value: It is necessary to choose a target selection strategy, there are only two of them:

data.name: TargetSelectionVoxelHint
data.value: A voxel is a 1x1 meter cube. From such voxels, you can make an array — the figure of the area in which the effect will be applied to the targets. In the picture an area of ​​five voxels is composed as an example. The maximum distance between adjacent voxels should not exceed the distance from the character to the area.

data.name: TargetsSizesHint
data.value: Choose the size of the targets that the ability will affect. The ability cannot be cast on targets of any other size category.

data.name: TargetVisibilityAREAHint
data.value: If this option is enabled, the character can position the area of action within the distance only if he sees the place where the geometric center of the area will be located. In chains, it is enough to see the first target.

data.name: TargetVisibilityNTADHint
data.value: If this option is enabled, the effects will be applied only to those targets that the character can see. It is assumed that the viewing angle of the character is 180 degrees. The character can decide which way he is looking just before activating the ability. In chains, it is enough to see the first target.

data.name: TooMuchSelfharmMessage
data.value: The maximum damage to the character itself should not exceed its maximum health points.

data.name: VoxelArrayIsArbitrary
data.value: The voxels are arbitrary positioned each time

data.name: WinEffectPageHint
data.value: This effect allows you to win the BRIX game. Instantly and irrevocably. The additional effect of this effect can be discussed within each specific party of players separately.
